message_1:
What is the membership value of an element x in a fuzzy set A defined by the membership function: 

μA(x) = 0.8 if 6 ≤ x ≤ 10 

μA(x) = (x-1)/(3+2x) if 10 < x ≤ 16 

μA(x) = 0 if x > 16 or x < 6 

Find the membership value of element x=11 in the fuzzy set A.
message_2:
To find the membership value of element x=11 in the fuzzy set A, we need to use the appropriate membership function. Since 10 < x ≤ 16, we will use the second membership function:

μA(x) = (x-1)/(3+2x)

Now, substitute x=11 into the equation:

μA(11) = (11-1)/(3+2*11) = 10/(3+22) = 10/25 = 2/5 = 0.4

So, the membership value of element x=11 in the fuzzy set A is 0.4.
